stanza.line: How heavy do I journey on the wayway
When what I seek (my weary travel end)end)
Doth teach that case and that repose to saysay
Thus far the miles are measured from thy friendfriend
The beast that bears me tired with my woewoe
Plods dully on to bear that weight in meme
As if by some instinct the wretch did knowknow
His rider loved not speed being made from theethee
The bloody spur cannot provoke him onon
That sometimes anger thrusts into his hidehide
Which heavily he answers with a groangroan
More sharp to me than spurring to his sideside
For that same groan doth put this in my mindmind
My grief lies onward and my joy behindbehind
